result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry G. Tanner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  

Submit to a mental health assessment and follow through with all recommendations/treatment.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete anger management program and any other educational programs or therapy ordered by the agent. 

Obey all rules and regulations of probation.  

Submit DNA sample. 

Pay costs.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terry G. Tanner in court with attorney Brian C. Hough. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states def will plead GNC to both counts for jt recommendation of withheld sentence for probation of 18 months with conditions of m.h. asst and ang. mgt asst; all other assts as required by agent; all treatments as required by agent; costs of the action.

Sentence withheld for 18 mo probation.  Conditions:  m. health assessment and follow through.  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete anger mgt program and any other educational programs/therapy ordered by agent.  Obey rules/regulations of probation.  Submit DNA sample.  Pay costs.

Attorney Brian C. Hough in court for Defendant Terry G. Tanner. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading waived.  Charges stated.  NG entered.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terry G. Tanner in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Def waives formal reading of complaint. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties as well as right to counsel. Def states he will not qualify for SPD. Court will allow def to have time to hire an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
